title: Optical Microscopy as an Evaluation Tool for Aerosol Jet Printing Optimization
content: Aerosol Jet Printing (AJP), a type of additive manufacturing, can revolutionize the development of biomedical sensors. The ability to print on nonplanar surfaces reduces the time between circuit design and fabrication and increases material options for soft polymer substrates, positioning AJP as a tool for circuit prototyping and development of flexible sensors [1].
